segment.source: Hyperlinks navigate the user to another part of the app, to another app, or launch a specific uniform resource identifier (URI) using a separate browser app.
segment.target: Hyperlinks navigate the user to another part of the app, to another app, or launch a specific uniform resource identifier (URI) using a separate browser app.

segment.source: Hyperlinks
segment.target: Hyperlinks

segment.source: Hyperlinks
segment.target: Hyperlinks

segment.source: Hyperlinks navigate the user to another part of the app, to another app, or launch a specific uniform resource identifier (URI) using a separate browser app.
segment.target: Hyperlinks navigate the user to another part of the app, to another app, or launch a specific uniform resource identifier (URI) using a separate browser app.

segment.source: There are two ways that you can add a hyperlink to a XAML app: the Hyperlink text element and HyperlinkButton control.
segment.target: There are two ways that you can add a hyperlink to a XAML app: the Hyperlink text element and HyperlinkButton control.

segment.source: A hyperlink button
segment.target: A hyperlink button

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: Hyperlink text element
segment.target: Hyperlink text element

segment.source: HyperlinkButton control
segment.target: HyperlinkButton control

segment.source: Is this the right control?
segment.target: Is this the right control?

segment.source: Use a hyperlink when you need text that responds when selected and navigates the user to more information about the text that was selected.
segment.target: Use a hyperlink when you need text that responds when selected and navigates the user to more information about the text that was selected.

segment.source: Choose the right type of hyperlink based on your needs:
segment.target: Choose the right type of hyperlink based on your needs:

segment.source: Use an inline Hyperlink text element inside of a text control.
segment.target: Use an inline Hyperlink text element inside of a text control.

segment.source: A Hyperlink element flows with other text elements and you can use it in any InlineCollection.
segment.target: A Hyperlink element flows with other text elements and you can use it in any InlineCollection.

segment.source: Use a text hyperlink if you want automatic text wrapping and don't necessarily need a large hit target.
segment.target: Use a text hyperlink if you want automatic text wrapping and don't necessarily need a large hit target.

segment.source: Hyperlink text can be small and difficult to target, especially for touch.
segment.target: Hyperlink text can be small and difficult to target, especially for touch.

segment.source: Use a HyperlinkButton for stand-alone hyperlinks.
segment.target: Use a HyperlinkButton for stand-alone hyperlinks.

segment.source: A HyperlinkButton is a specialized Button control that you can use anywhere that you would use a Button.
segment.target: A HyperlinkButton is a specialized Button control that you can use anywhere that you would use a Button.

segment.source: Use a HyperlinkButton with an Image as its content to make a clickable image.
segment.target: Use a HyperlinkButton with an Image as its content to make a clickable image.

segment.source: Examples
segment.target: Examples

segment.source: Hyperlinks in the Calculator app.
segment.target: Hyperlinks in the Calculator app.

segment.source: Example of a hyperlink in the Calculator app
segment.target: Example of a hyperlink in the Calculator app

segment.source: Create a Hyperlink text element
segment.target: Create a Hyperlink text element

segment.source: This example shows how to use a Hyperlink text element inside of a TextBlock.
segment.target: This example shows how to use a Hyperlink text element inside of a TextBlock.

segment.source: The hyperlink appears inline and flows with the surrounding text:
segment.target: The hyperlink appears inline and flows with the surrounding text:

segment.source: Example of a hyperlink as a text element
segment.target: Example of a hyperlink as a text element

segment.source: TipWhen you use a Hyperlink in a text control with other text elements in XAML, place the content in a Span container and apply the attribute to the Span to keep the white space between the Hyperlink and other elements.
segment.target: TipWhen you use a Hyperlink in a text control with other text elements in XAML, place the content in a Span container and apply the attribute to the Span to keep the white space between the Hyperlink and other elements.

segment.source: Create a HyperlinkButton
segment.target: Create a HyperlinkButton

segment.source: Here's how to use a HyperlinkButton, both with text and with an image.
segment.target: Here's how to use a HyperlinkButton, both with text and with an image.

segment.source: The hyperlink buttons with text content appear as marked-up text.
segment.target: The hyperlink buttons with text content appear as marked-up text.

segment.source: The Contoso logo image is also a clickable hyperlink:
segment.target: The Contoso logo image is also a clickable hyperlink:

segment.source: Example of a hyperlink as a button control
segment.target: Example of a hyperlink as a button control

segment.source: Handle navigation
segment.target: Handle navigation

segment.source: For both kinds of hyperlinks, you handle navigation the same way; you can set the NavigateUri property, or handle the Click event.
segment.target: For both kinds of hyperlinks, you handle navigation the same way; you can set the NavigateUri property, or handle the Click event.

segment.source: Navigate to a URI
segment.target: Navigate to a URI

segment.source: To use the hyperlink to navigate to a URI, set the NavigateUri property.
segment.target: To use the hyperlink to navigate to a URI, set the NavigateUri property.

segment.source: When a user clicks or taps the hyperlink, the specified URI opens in the default browser.
segment.target: When a user clicks or taps the hyperlink, the specified URI opens in the default browser.

segment.source: The default browser runs in a separate process from your app.
segment.target: The default browser runs in a separate process from your app.

segment.source: NoteYou don't have to use http: or https: schemes.
segment.target: NoteYou don't have to use http: or https: schemes.

segment.source: You can use schemes such as ms-appx:, ms-appdata:, or ms-resources:, if there's resource content at these locations that's appropriate to load in a browser.
segment.target: You can use schemes such as ms-appx:, ms-appdata:, or ms-resources:, if there's resource content at these locations that's appropriate to load in a browser.

segment.source: However, the file: scheme is specifically blocked.
segment.target: However, the file: scheme is specifically blocked.

segment.source: For more info, see URI schemes.
segment.target: For more info, see URI schemes.

segment.source: When a user clicks the hyperlink, the value of the NavigateUri property is passed to a system handler for URI types and schemes.
segment.target: When a user clicks the hyperlink, the value of the NavigateUri property is passed to a system handler for URI types and schemes.

segment.source: The system then launches the app that is registered for the scheme of the URI provided for NavigateUri.
segment.target: The system then launches the app that is registered for the scheme of the URI provided for NavigateUri.

segment.source: If you don't want the hyperlink to load content in a default Web browser (and don't want a browser to appear), then don't set a value for NavigateUri.
segment.target: If you don't want the hyperlink to load content in a default Web browser (and don't want a browser to appear), then don't set a value for NavigateUri.

segment.source: Instead, handle the Click event, and write code that does what you want.
segment.target: Instead, handle the Click event, and write code that does what you want.

segment.source: Handle the Click event
segment.target: Handle the Click event

segment.source: Use the Click event for actions other than launching a URI in a browser, such as navigation within the app.
segment.target: Use the Click event for actions other than launching a URI in a browser, such as navigation within the app.

segment.source: For example, if you want to load a new app page rather than opening a browser, call a Frame.Navigate method within your Click event handler to navigate to the new app page.
segment.target: For example, if you want to load a new app page rather than opening a browser, call a Frame.Navigate method within your Click event handler to navigate to the new app page.

segment.source: If you want an external, absolute URI to load within a WebView control that also exists in your app, call WebView.Navigate as part of your Click handler logic.
segment.target: If you want an external, absolute URI to load within a WebView control that also exists in your app, call WebView.Navigate as part of your Click handler logic.

segment.source: You don't typically handle the Click event as well as specifying a NavigateUri value, as these represent two different ways of using the hyperlink element.
segment.target: You don't typically handle the Click event as well as specifying a NavigateUri value, as these represent two different ways of using the hyperlink element.

segment.source: If your intent is to open the URI in the default browser, and you have specified a value for NavigateUri, don't handle the Click event.
segment.target: If your intent is to open the URI in the default browser, and you have specified a value for NavigateUri, don't handle the Click event.

segment.source: Conversely, if you handle the Click event, don't specify a NavigateUri.
segment.target: Conversely, if you handle the Click event, don't specify a NavigateUri.

segment.source: There's nothing you can do within the Click event handler to prevent the default browser from loading any valid target specified for NavigateUri; that action takes place automatically (asynchronously) when the hyperlink is activated and can't be canceled from within the Click event handler.
segment.target: There's nothing you can do within the Click event handler to prevent the default browser from loading any valid target specified for NavigateUri; that action takes place automatically (asynchronously) when the hyperlink is activated and can't be canceled from within the Click event handler.

segment.source: Hyperlink underlines
segment.target: Hyperlink underlines

segment.source: By default, hyperlinks are underlined.
segment.target: By default, hyperlinks are underlined.

segment.source: This underline is important because it helps meet accessibility requirements.
segment.target: This underline is important because it helps meet accessibility requirements.

segment.source: Color-blind users use the underline to distinguish between hyperlinks and other text.
segment.target: Color-blind users use the underline to distinguish between hyperlinks and other text.

segment.source: If you disable underlines, you should consider adding some other type of formatting difference to distinguish hyperlinks from other text, such as FontWeight or FontStyle.
segment.target: If you disable underlines, you should consider adding some other type of formatting difference to distinguish hyperlinks from other text, such as FontWeight or FontStyle.

segment.source: Hyperlink text elements
segment.target: Hyperlink text elements

segment.source: You can set the UnderlineStyle property to disable the underline.
segment.target: You can set the UnderlineStyle property to disable the underline.

segment.source: If you do, consider using FontWeight or FontStyle to differentiate your link text.
segment.target: If you do, consider using FontWeight or FontStyle to differentiate your link text.

segment.source: HyperlinkButton
segment.target: HyperlinkButton

segment.source: By default, the HyperlinkButton appears as underlined text when you set a string as the value for the Content property.
segment.target: By default, the HyperlinkButton appears as underlined text when you set a string as the value for the Content property.

segment.source: The text does not appear underlined in the following cases:
segment.target: The text does not appear underlined in the following cases:

segment.source: You set a TextBlock as the value for the Content property, and set the Text property on the TextBlock.
segment.target: You set a TextBlock as the value for the Content property, and set the Text property on the TextBlock.

segment.source: You re-template the HyperlinkButton and change the name of the ContentPresenter template part.
segment.target: You re-template the HyperlinkButton and change the name of the ContentPresenter template part.

segment.source: If you need a button that appears as non-underlined text, consider using a standard Button control and applying the built-in system resource to its Style property.
segment.target: If you need a button that appears as non-underlined text, consider using a standard Button control and applying the built-in system resource to its Style property.

segment.source: Notes for Hyperlink text element
segment.target: Notes for Hyperlink text element

segment.source: This section applies only to the Hyperlink text element, not to the HyperlinkButton control.
segment.target: This section applies only to the Hyperlink text element, not to the HyperlinkButton control.

segment.source: Input events
segment.target: Input events

segment.source: Because a Hyperlink is not a UIElement, it does not have the set of UI element input events such as Tapped, PointerPressed, and so on.
segment.target: Because a Hyperlink is not a UIElement, it does not have the set of UI element input events such as Tapped, PointerPressed, and so on.

segment.source: Instead, a Hyperlink has its own Click event, plus the implicit behavior of the system loading any URI specified as the NavigateUri.
segment.target: Instead, a Hyperlink has its own Click event, plus the implicit behavior of the system loading any URI specified as the NavigateUri.

segment.source: The system handles all input actions that should invoke the Hyperlink actions and raises the Click event in response.
segment.target: The system handles all input actions that should invoke the Hyperlink actions and raises the Click event in response.

segment.source: Content
segment.target: Content

segment.source: Hyperlink has restrictions on the content that can exist in its Inlines collection.
segment.target: Hyperlink has restrictions on the content that can exist in its Inlines collection.

segment.source: Specifically, a Hyperlink only permits Run and other Span types that aren't another Hyperlink.
segment.target: Specifically, a Hyperlink only permits Run and other Span types that aren't another Hyperlink.

segment.source: InlineUIContainer can't be in the Inlines collection of a Hyperlink.
segment.target: InlineUIContainer can't be in the Inlines collection of a Hyperlink.

segment.source: Attempting to add restricted content throws an invalid argument exception or XAML parse exception.
segment.target: Attempting to add restricted content throws an invalid argument exception or XAML parse exception.

segment.source: Hyperlink and theme/style behavior
segment.target: Hyperlink and theme/style behavior

segment.source: Hyperlink doesn't inherit from Control, so it doesn't have a Style property or a Template.
segment.target: Hyperlink doesn't inherit from Control, so it doesn't have a Style property or a Template.

segment.source: You can edit the properties that are inherited from TextElement, such as Foreground or FontFamily, to change the appearance of a Hyperlink, but you can't use a common style or template to apply changes.
segment.target: You can edit the properties that are inherited from TextElement, such as Foreground or FontFamily, to change the appearance of a Hyperlink, but you can't use a common style or template to apply changes.

segment.source: Instead of using a template, consider using common resources for values of Hyperlink properties to provide consistency.
segment.target: Instead of using a template, consider using common resources for values of Hyperlink properties to provide consistency.

segment.source: Some properties of Hyperlink use defaults from a {ThemeResource} markup extension value provided by the system.
segment.target: Some properties of Hyperlink use defaults from a {ThemeResource} markup extension value provided by the system.

segment.source: This enables the Hyperlink appearance to switch in appropriate ways when the user changes the system theme at run-time.
segment.target: This enables the Hyperlink appearance to switch in appropriate ways when the user changes the system theme at run-time.

segment.source: The default color of the hyperlink is the accent color of the system.
segment.target: The default color of the hyperlink is the accent color of the system.

segment.source: You can set the Foreground property to override this.
segment.target: You can set the Foreground property to override this.

segment.source: Recommendations
segment.target: Recommendations

segment.source: Only use hyperlinks for navigation; don't use them for other actions.
segment.target: Only use hyperlinks for navigation; don't use them for other actions.

segment.source: Use the Body style from the type ramp for text-based hyperlinks.
segment.target: Use the Body style from the type ramp for text-based hyperlinks.

segment.source: Read about fonts and the Windows 10 type ramp.
segment.target: Read about fonts and the Windows 10 type ramp.

segment.source: Keep discrete hyperlinks far enough apart so that the user can differentiate between them and has an easy time selecting each one.
segment.target: Keep discrete hyperlinks far enough apart so that the user can differentiate between them and has an easy time selecting each one.

segment.source: Add tooltips to hyperlinks that indicate to where the user will be directed.
segment.target: Add tooltips to hyperlinks that indicate to where the user will be directed.

segment.source: If the user will be directed to an external site, include the top-level domain name inside the tooltip, and style the text with a secondary font color.
segment.target: If the user will be directed to an external site, include the top-level domain name inside the tooltip, and style the text with a secondary font color.

segment.source: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
segment.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF.\]
segment.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF.\]
